snippet: Nearly two-thirds of individual donors over the last six months gave $1,000 or more to the governor, while about a fifth gave less than $250, new campaign filings show.
abstract: Latest campaign filings show that nearly two-thirds of individual donors to coffers of Gov Andrew M Cuomo over the last six months gave $1,000 or more, while about a fifth gave less than $250; Cuomo's office issues statement, explaining that because the governor is not up for re-election until 2014, his current fund-raising focuses on big donors.
lead_paragraph: Nearly two-thirds of individual donors over the last six months gave $1,000 or more to the governor, while about a fifth gave less than $250, new campaign filings show.

headline.seo: Bigger Donations Aid Cuomo’s Campaign Treasury
headline.main: Larger Donations Swell Cuomo Campaign Account
headline.print_headline: Larger Donations Swell Cuomo Campaign Account
